snippet: On Monday night, Cherubini's "Médée" takes to the stage of the Théâtre des Champs-Élysées as the third and last work of a mini-festival this fall of operas about Greek mythology's most famous woman spurned. On the podium, will be Christophe...
abstract: On Monday night, Cherubini's "Médée" takes to the stage of the Théâtre des Champs-Élysées as the third and last work of a mini-festival this fall of operas about Greek mythology's most famous woman spurned. On the podium, will be Christophe Rousset, who prefers Cherubini's version. Have you seen the three Medeas? Which composer do you think does it best?

headline.main: And Now, Round 3 in the Medea Sing-Off
